summary: Email from attorney Teri Gibbs to prosecutors regarding two clients who believe they were assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein in June 2004. The email arranges interviews for the victims and includes photographs from 2004 for identification purposes, requesting confirmation if they appear in photos seized from Epstein's home.

persons.name: Teri Gibbs
persons.context: Author of the email, arranging interviews for two clients who allege assault by Jeffrey Epstein in 2004.

persons.name: Lisa Bloom
persons.context: Copied on the email, likely involved in the legal representation of Epstein's victims.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the criminal case (19 Cr. 490 (RMB)), alleged to have assaulted the attorney's clients in June 2004.

events.title: Alleged assaults by Epstein
events.description: Two clients of Teri Gibbs believe they were assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein in or around June 2004.

events.title: Attorney-prosecutor call
events.description: Teri Gibbs' firm spoke with prosecutors regarding their clients' allegations against Epstein.

events.title: Scheduled victim interview
events.description: One victim is available for an in-person interview with prosecutors on August 26 or 27, 2019.

keyFacts: Two new victims came forward in August 2019 alleging assaults by Jeffrey Epstein in June 2004.
Attorneys provided photographs of the victims from 2004 to prosecutors for identification against photos seized from Epstein's home.
The email is part of criminal case 19 Cr. 490 (RMB) against Epstein.
Victim interviews were being scheduled for late August 2019 via in-person and video conference.
The communication shows ongoing investigation and victim coordination by legal teams in 2019.
